alert.note: Alert for Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 1:29PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hot Springs County through 200 PM MDT... At 129 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hamilton Dome, which is also 22 miles west of Thermopolis, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Hot Springs County, including the following locations... Hot Springs County Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin
